thread.title: Hope Bobcat Football: Cats move up to No. 4 ranking after conf. win over Watson Chapel; QB Austin Stubber throws career-high 458 yards passing
thread.title_full: Hope Bobcat Football: Cats move up to No. 4 ranking after conf. win over Watson Chapel; QB Austin Stubber throws career-high 458 yards passing

author: Gerren Smith
title: Hope Bobcat Football: Cats move up to No. 4 ranking after conf. win over Watson Chapel; QB Austin Stubber throws career-high 458 yards passing
text: Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 9:24 AM Hope, Ark. After posting one of their biggest comeback wins in Hope Bobcat football program against Watson Chapel 55-49, the Cat's have moved up in the rankings. The Bobcats received the No. 4 in state for class 5A ranking by the Associated Press Arkansas Prep Poll Ranking for week seven of high school football. The Bobcats racked up a season-high 540 total yards of offense led by a career-high passing yards of junior starting quarterback Austin Stubber. He made 39 completions for 458 yards passing for his most as a Bobcat. Thus far, Stubber has passed for over 1, 700 yards and averaging over 200 yards a game. Senior receivers' Trey Lawson, C.J. Briggs and Andrew Washington with junior Kadarius Munn are leading the team in receptions for touchdowns. Lawson had two TD's, Briggs and Washington each had one TD reception and two-point conversion reception against Watson Chapel. Friday's win was the first time the Bobcats defeated Watson Chapel once they arrived in 5A South Conference play during the reign of Jay Turley as head coach of the Hope football program. The Cats' defense came up big with huge key stops at critical times during game. They totaled for 70 tackles against a strong solid Wildcat team. Thus far, the Cats' defense have totaled for 457 tackles through six games, including a series of sacks and interceptions. The Bobcats continue their streak wins since their one point loss to Nashville in the season opener. They haven't lost since then and currently on a five game winning streak 5-1 overall and unbeaten in conference at 3-0. This Friday, the Bobcats return on the road to face the Hot Springs Lakeside Rams. Both teams are unbeaten in conference tied for first place in league standings. The Rams picked up for votes for ranking this week and considered for one of the top five spots the last three weeks for class 5A. Pulaski Academy remains with the overall No.1 ranking in state for class 5A, followed by Little Rock Christian at No. 2 and Sylvan Hills No. 3 all 6-0 overall. Batesville remains ranked in the No. 5 spot to dropped one spot this week being replaced by Hope. Blytheville was the other team considered for ranking in class 5A for votes with Lakeside. Associated Press Arkansas Prep Poll Rankings For Week 7 CLASS 5A
